elements.content: Understanding the Upstream Data Control Category
ðŸ’¡ Key Insight: Expanso doesn't compete with your platformsâ€”we make them cheaper. You keep Snowflake, Databricks, Splunk, and Datadog. You just pay 50-70% less.

visual_language.column_highlight: Expanso column visually emphasized with green tint
visual_language.category_focus: Category column darker to separate from data

presentation_notes.opening: This is a backup slide in case you get the question: 'How do you compare to X?' Let me show you the competitive landscape.
presentation_notes.context: We're often asked how we compare to cloud platforms, ETL tools, or observability platforms. The truth is: we don't really compete with them. We're a different category entirely.

table_walkthrough.where_runs: [Point to row 1] First, where does it run? Expanso runs at the sourceâ€”at the edge, on-prem, in your VPC. Cloud platforms only run in the cloud after ingestion. ETL tools run cloud or hybrid but post-extraction. Observability tools run in the cloud.
table_walkthrough.purpose: [Point to row 2] Primary purpose: We filter and optimize BEFORE the cloud. Cloud platforms store and analyze data. ETL tools move data between systems. Observability tools monitor and alert.
table_walkthrough.data_reduction: [Point to row 3] Data reduction: We reduce 50 to 70%. Cloud platforms want MORE dataâ€”that's their business model. ETL tools move ALL data. Observability tools store ALL logs.
table_walkthrough.cost_impact: [Point to row 4] Cost impact: We REDUCE platform costs by 50 to 70%. Cloud platforms ARE the primary cost center. ETL tools ADD cost through connector fees. Observability tools ARE the primary cost center.
table_walkthrough.compliance: [Point to row 5] PII compliance: We filter at the source BEFORE the cloud. Cloud platforms do masking after ingestion. ETL tools have limited or no compliance features. Observability tools do redaction after ingestion.
table_walkthrough.works_with: [Point to row 6] Works with: We work with ALL platformsâ€”we're non-exclusive. Cloud platforms only work with themselves. ETL tools work with specific sources and destinations. Observability tools only work with themselves.
table_walkthrough.business_model: [Point to row 7] Business model: We charge a percentage of savingsâ€”our incentives are aligned with yours. Cloud platforms are volume-basedâ€”more data equals more money. ETL is per-connector or volume. Observability is volume-based.

presentation_notes.key_takeaway: [Point to bottom] Here's the key insight: Expanso doesn't compete with your platformsâ€”we make them cheaper. You keep Snowflake, Databricks, Splunk, and Datadog. You just pay 50 to 70% less.
presentation_notes.transition: Any questions about how we fit into your existing stack?
presentation_notes.usage_note: Only use this slide if explicitly asked about competition. Don't volunteer itâ€”it can create confusion about category.

procurement.talking_points: Non-exclusive, aligned incentives, reduces existing vendor costs

finance.talking_points: Cost reduction not cost addition, performance-based pricing

when_to_show: Prospect asks 'How do you compare to [competitor]?'
Procurement wants to understand category positioning
Need to clarify that Expanso complements rather than replaces existing tools
when_not_to_show: Unprompted in standard pitch (creates unnecessary confusion)
Early in sales cycle (focus on value, not competition)
Technical deep-dives (engineers don't care about competition)
